comments.body: Is it possible to make this testcase work on Windows? Should we open a tracking issue to track all the LinuxOnly test cases and see if it is possible to make it work for Windows?
It is possible. But need sometime to find a way to replace those linux commands. I will open an issue for it
could these be computed based on the test file generation instead of hardcoded?

Actually, I've just move it from volume_io.go defined in test/e2e/storage, and I would like to make this kind of improvement out of the scope of this refactoring. 
We would be able to improve it in a separate commit.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +45,49 @@// If test file generation algorithm changes, these must be recomputed.
var md5hashes = map[int64]string{
	testpatterns.FileSizeSmall:  "5c34c2813223a7ca05a3c2f38c0d1710",
	testpatterns.FileSizeMedium: "f2fa202b1ffeedda5f3a58bd1ae81104",
	testpatterns.FileSizeLarge:  "8d763edc71bd16217664793b5a15e403",

comments.body: A general question: have you timed runs of these tests vs. the old ones? are there any significant performance increases/decreases? Are we running the exact same set of tests (at least the same number) now as before

Not yet measured the exact time it takes, however, I just changed how we call the tests, not the test logics themselves, so the test will take the same time. 
Also, I applied these tests to other drivers, so some drivers might take much time to execute volumeIO test. However, I defined MaxFileSize in driverInfo, so the size of the files to be tested for each driver can be tuned by using this parameter.
(Note that it doesn't take much time for drivers that can be tested in my test environment. Drivers that is tested in my environments are nfs, iSCSI, rbd, ceph, hostpath, hostpathSymlink, emptyDir.)

This refactoring will run more tests than before.  Which is good.  Previously, you needed to create a test case for every plugin.  This refactoring makes it easier to run any test case against any plugin.
